subject: getting specific information on where a test failed.
msgSnippet: I m using junit3.8.1 and running my tests through the junit ant task. I have a problem where an exception is getting thrown in a worker thread, and I m not
messageBody:
I'm using junit3.8.1 and running my tests through the junit ant task.

I have a problem where an exception is getting thrown in a worker
thread, and I'm not able to get specific information about which test
it failed on from junit. If I just print the information to standard
out it gets pushed together with all the other stdout information and
doesn't tell me what test was running when it was printed. If I call
System.exit(1), then I get a BUILDFAILED message that tells me what
*class* containing the tests failed, but it doesn't tell me the exact
method of the test.

How can I force more specific output? Should I be using a different
test runner? I need one that will work with junit 3.8.1.

Thanks,
Brendan
